About.title: Overview
About.des: The hotel provides non-smoking rooms. There is a bicycle rental shop. Pets are allowed. Guests can park their car in the free parking lot. Internet access is available. The hot tub is very beneficial for health; here you have the opportunity to use this service. There is an outdoor pool available. The property features a well-maintained garden.

the_space.title: The Space
the_space.des: In front of the villa, there is a spacious summer kitchen with a wood-burning fireplace used for dining and entertainment (table football, darts, and billiards). There is also a workroom and a bathroom. Next to the summer kitchen, there is a **68 m² swimming pool with air massage and a waterfall**. A traditional Istrian ‘kazun’ made of stone adds a rustic touch, featuring a grill and baking area. A large terrace stretches along one side of the villa, offering sea and garden views — an ideal place for dining and relaxation.
the_space.des2: It consists of a spacious living room, a fully equipped kitchen, **7 charming bedrooms with bathrooms, air conditioning, and TV**. Each room has heating radiators. All rooms are air-conditioned. There is also a wellness room ( **sauna, jacuzzi, fitness equipment**), a garage with **2 parking spaces**, and **8 bicycles**. The parking area can accommodate over a dozen vehicles.

guest_access.title: Guest Access
guest_access.des: Jacuzzi, parking, table football, outdoor pool, barbecue

locations.title: What to visit:
des: - Explore the beautiful islands of Brijuni National Park, rich in natural beauty and cultural heritage.
- Discover the ancient Roman amphitheater in Pula, one of the best-preserved in the world.
- Dive into the underwater world at Pula Aquarium, near the city center. Explore diverse marine habitats, observe marine species, and learn about ocean conservation.
- Experience thrilling slides, lazy rivers, and relaxing pools at Istralandia water park near Novigrad. Perfect for families and water lovers — a fun day for all ages.

Villa_Description.des: The hotel provides non-smoking rooms. There is a bicycle rental shop. Pets are allowed. Guests can park their car in the free parking lot. Internet access is available. The hot tub is very beneficial for health; here you have the opportunity to use this service. There is an outdoor pool available. The property features a well-maintained garden.
Villa_Description.subtitle: The Space
Villa_Description.des2: In front of the villa, there is an outdoor pool (68 m²) with air massage and a waterfall. The spacious lawn offers a children’s playground with a trampoline and football goals. Next to the pool is a replica of an old Istrian house called a "kazun" with barbecue facilities. A beautiful terrace is perfect for enjoying meals. Another dining area is the summer kitchen within the game room (darts, billiards, table football). The beauty room next to the villa offers a sauna, jacuzzi, and fitness equipment. The villa has a surveillance system for security. It can accommodate 16 people and features 7 bedrooms: 3 with king-size beds (2 people each), and 4 with twin beds. Additional sleeping space is available on the sofas in the living room.
Villa_Description.des3: Guests have access to 7 bedrooms, 2 living rooms, 2 kitchens, 9 bathrooms + separate WC, balconies, terrace, beauty room, games/summer kitchen, "kazun" with barbecue, laundry room with ironing facilities, pool, lawn, garden, playground, and the entire outdoor area (2500 m²).

Payment_conditions.subtitle: PAYMENT AND BOOKING CONDITIONS
Payment_conditions.title: Payment and Booking Terms
Payment_conditions.des: Tourist tax is not included in the price!
Payment_conditions.des2: To confirm the reservation, 30% of the total amount must be paid in advance directly to the accommodation owner, and 70% upon arrival.
Payment_conditions.des3: Refundable deposit if everything is fine: 500 euros.
Payment_conditions.des4: Free cancellation within one week after booking (EXCEPT LAST-MINUTE BOOKINGS, THEN 48 HOURS). Last-minute booking – two weeks before arrival.
Payment_conditions.des5: On the last day of stay, guests must leave the accommodation by 10 a.m., so that others can check in from 4 p.m.
Payment_conditions.des6: Note: Pets are not allowed on the property.

steps.title: Send Inquiry
steps.des: Please send us an inquiry via the contact form, email, or phone with all required information and desired stay period in the Villa Relax holiday home. Expect a quick email reply and our best offer.
steps.des2: To confirm your reservation, 30% of the total price must be paid in advance, and the rest upon arrival. After payment, please send us proof, and we’ll send you a confirmation of payment and booking. There are 2 ways to pay: bank transfer or PayPal (debit and credit cards).
steps.subtitle: Bank Transfer
steps.des3: Once payment is completed, we’ll confirm your reservation. Relax and look forward to your summer stay at Villa Bergi, Istria – Croatia!

Environs.title: Žminj & Istria
Environs.des: Žminj is a picturesque Istrian town located in the center of the peninsula, known for its traditional architecture and peaceful, authentic atmosphere. Surrounded by hills, vineyards, and olive groves, it is an ideal place for relaxation and discovering Istrian culture.
Environs.des2: The villa can be reached by car or taxi. Free parking is available on-site.
Environs.subtitle: Nearby Attractions

rovinj.title1: 1. The Old Town Was an Island
rovinj.des1: Until the 18th century, Rovinj was a real island. In 1763 the Austrians filled in the channel and connected it to the mainland. That's why the streets are so narrow and winding – designed for defense, not comfort.
rovinj.des2: The Church of St. Euphemia has the tallest bell tower in Istria – 62 meters – and the statue of St. Euphemia on top rotates depending on the wind direction.
rovinj.des3: In the Old Town, many houses have doors and windows directly on the sea, typical of old Venetian fishing towns and one of Rovinj’s most iconic sights.
rovinj.des4: The batana is a small flat-bottomed wooden boat, a symbol of Rovinj’s fishing tradition. It has its own Ecomuseum listed on the UNESCO Intangible Heritage list.
rovinj.des5: Balbi’s Arch from the 17th century marks the entrance to the Old Town. It features carved heads of a Turk and a Venetian, a reminder of Venetian rule.
rovinj.des6: Golden Cape (Punta Corrente) is one of the most beautiful places for walking and cycling in Istria, known for its pine forest, coves, and crystal-clear sea.
rovinj.des7: Rovinj is considered one of the most romantic towns in Europe thanks to its sea views, picturesque narrow streets, and spectacular sunsets.
